bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Memorandum to Wade Hampton Frost, August 24, 1930

div1.p: This document lists illustrative material to be included in Carter's "History of Yellow Fever," for which permissions to reproduce will be required.

div1.head: Memorandum to Wade Hampton Frost, August 24, 1930
div1.opener:
Memorandum, No. 2
(for W. H. F.)
August 24, 1930.
div1.p:
Part of Illustrative Material
for which publisher of Carter's book will have to get permission
to reproduce.

list.item: 1: FFrontice pieces if copyright material is used.

3: Tracings for year 1 Rabbit, (p404) from
(a) Codex Telleriano-Remensis
(b) Codex Kubin
(c) Codex Vaticanus.
Mem. These tracings were made from books at
the Carnegie Institution of Washington, D. C.,
with the permission of the Institution, ver-
bally transmitted through Dr. Sylvanus G.
Morley, with the understanding that this
courtesy was to be acknowledged, in commone
with all other illustrative material put at
our disposal. I should think that the pub-
lishers of the above mentioned Codices should
also have to be approached re copyright. This
might be done through the Carnegie Institution.

item.p:
4: Photostat, re “xekik” (“blood-vomit”) of 1648, from
Book of Chilam Balam of Chumayel,
Gordon's photostat.

Our photostat was made at
the Library of Congress.

div1.p:
(Further details re above on library cards in possession W. H. F.)
(Above material is also in possession W. H. F.)
